name: icca
address: 20 Warren St, New York, NY 10007, USA

reviews.text: I have been holding back in writing this review because I thought time and distance would help me to calm down.  Well, it did not work because I am still enraged over my time and money i wasted at this place.  Why is it still in business and how did this place get 1 star from Michelin?  We were a party of 3, paid over $1700 and that price did not include any alcohol.  My husband booked this place as a surprise and he will never be forgiven for this fiasco.  We have experienced other 1 and 2 stars, paid much less and enjoyed 10 times more.  The chef kept on bragging how everything was from Hokkaido and that was a point of pride for him in his head.  None of us were impressed and did not really care where the ingredient was from when every piece was so mediocre in taste and quality.  There was an arrogance to the chef that forced us to smile and obligated to compliment him with every piece he served us.  We felt like captive animals in the zoo waiting to make our great escape.  All i wanted to do was scream the entire time, run out of the place and get our money back. In the meantime, we kept on drinking the sparkling water to wash out the taste in our mouth and thought the water was included in the fixed price menu of a whopping $1,600.  Nope!  The meal of $1600 was prepaid by my insane husband and they handed us another receipt in a fancy wood box telling us to pay another $170+ for the water they kept on serving us.  The point of this review is for you to think twice before you book and overpay for this so called 1 star Michelin.   UGH!!!

Traditional omakase counter restaurant, however the food and the whole experience has a next level twist. The chef pushes outside the traditional sushi path and combines things like sashimi with fermented okra jelly (delicious). You'll get a bit of everything - nigris (some of them are experimental), different forms of tuna, grilled fish and meat too. We opted for sake pairing and it was absolutely worth it from taste perspective, but we'd like to highlight the knowledge of the staff describing the differences and nuances to us. You might also get a complimentary Koshu wine from japan that goes with one of the dishes.
Usluga je bila hladna ali je hrana bila topla i super

The best omakase in the city! Every piece was incredibly fresh and beautifully presented. The chefâ€™s attention to detail and creativity made the experience unforgettable. The staff were so kind, attentive, and made us feel completely at home. Each bite was perfection â€” delicious, balanced, and full of flavor.

Very nice place! A bit hard to find given being on a Main Street. The interior is welcoming and modern. There were a few minor odd choices for a Michelin star restaurant: disposable chopsticks, and laminated plastic signs on the doors.

The food was a fusion of Japanese and Italian cuisine, and felt completely unique. Flavors that i I didnâ€™t know worked together were delicious. Would definitely return.

They shine in the kitchen and perform well on the floor. The clean flavors really shine through. The experience was worth the wait. Staff - excellent - welcoming and watchful. This spot never fails me and won't fail you.

We had a nice time, but the omakase simply isnâ€™t worth the $500 pp, particularly when you consider some of the great alternatives.  The venue/decor is very nice, but the service is shaky and the chef limits eye contact and says as little as possible in a hard-to-hear tone (as others have noted).  The food was good, but not great (what you would expect at this price point).  It has potential and I wanted to love it, but it just isnâ€™t commensurate with the price tag.

My brother went here with his friends, told the staff that he is allergic to crab, fish. Server nodded, did not speak english, served him fish and he had a severe allergic reaction that he had to leave and end up in the ER. Horrid place. Definitely should be held responsible for putting someoneâ€™s life in danger. Do not go if you have allergies.

I had my good bye dinner with my manager here. It was absolutely amazing.

I like how the food is not strictly traditional. I feel that the chef put a lot of heart and feeling into each of his dishes, which is very special.

We tasted an abundance of flavors for all the dishes and absolutely love the chefâ€™s touch of modern innovation. The atmosphere was fun and friendly, which we enjoy as well.

My favorite is definitely the unbelievably delicious beef, the Uni and crab pasta, and the melon dessert, which are all refreshing and very enjoyable.

Every dish was absolutely delicious! About half of the courses were things I hadnâ€™t seen in other omakase experiences â€” creative flavors with pleasant surprises ğŸ¥°. The ingredients were fresh and high quality. I really enjoyed the entire experience and will definitely come back again!
My fav omakase in ny c

Icca is best known for their Japanese cuisine, but I was introduced to their Italian Kappo Counter by a friend.

Italian Kappo Counter (Non-Sushi Course)
According to their site, Kappo is a refined, multi-course dining experience that bridges the gap between the formal Kaiseki and Izakaya styles. Originating from the Edo Era, Kappo is a high-class cuisine that grew in popularity during the Taishou and early Showa eras.

Tasting course contains the following:
Ippakusuisei "Premium" - Fan Lobster, Scallop, Caviar, Udo, Strawberry
Haneya - Striped Beakfish, Ponzu Julep
Tedorikawa Yamahai - Japanese Blackfin Seabass, White Asparagus
Dassai Blue "Nama" - Fennel, Tomato, Julep, Snow Crab, Sea Urchin
Jikon "Tokubetsu Junmai" - Cherry Trout, Bamboo Shoots
Suirakuten Reserve Aged 20 Years - "Tokachi Herb Beef" Steak
Icca Soup
Iwa 5 - Bolognese Risotto with "Tokachi Herb Beef"
Masuizumi "Kijoshu" - Chestnut, Monaka
Roasted Green Tea

The Ippakusuisei "Premium" was incredible--delicate seafood paired with strawberry sounds risky, but it all came together beautifully. The Tedorikawa Yamahai was a standout, topped with a generous amount of truffle that elevated the entire dish. Dassai Blue "Nama" leaned a bit more fish-forward, but the flavors were expertly balanced. The Suirakuten Reserve steak was exceptionally tender and full of depth. To end, the Masuizumi "Kijoshu" with roasted green tea provided a perfect balance of sweetness and earthiness--an elegant close to the meal. I cannot speak for the other menu offerings at Icca, but I do believe this establishment has mastered their craft and are able to combine it with creativity. I did not have one bad bite throughout the entire meal.

Icca is my favorite sushiya in NYC. Suzuki-san is a seasoned shokunin that should command respect from any diner that is able to experience his omakase. A multitude of otsumami and nigiri fill the night with immense pleasure for your palate. The signature course of Icca is the awabi liver shari. The umami and textures from this signature course are unbelievably divine and unrivaled. On top of all the culinary mastery, Suzuki-san is a friendly and jovial guy that is a willing conversationalist. Iâ€™ve visited three times thus far and always make it a priority to visit any time I visit Manhattan.

One of the best omakase experience I ever had in the city! The concept was Italian Kappo (basically italian/japanese style) and every single food I had here was served in a unique way and tasted delicious (if i can have a second round of each item, i definitely would lol). Service was top notch, chef was super friendly and described every single item perfectly. The atmosphere inside was very chill & relaxing so it was perfect for date night.

Overall, would highly recommend if you're looking for a unique omakase experience that includes an italian twist to Japanese cuisine.

Every course was comforting and full of fresh vegetables â€” my body was truly happy! ğŸ¥¦âœ¨ğŸ˜Š Each dish was painstakingly prepared â³ğŸ³, and hearing the chef describe the time and care behind every detail made the experience feel incredibly special âœ¨ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ³â¤ï¸. Pure luxury. ğŸ½ï¸ğŸ·ğŸŒ¿
The food was excellent especially the opening dish, though the servings small and the ambiance at the bar was only good.

We were there to celebrate the birthday, but itâ€™s a horrible experience. We arrived on time but had to wait for more than half an hour before seating in. We didnâ€™t even get an apology. The sushi is pretty normal, not bad, but just ordinary. And during the whole dinner chef is just talking with the familiar guests.
Incredible food and display of skill by the chefs.  A range of types of seafood, all deliciously prepared, very good sake, pleasant music, and great service.  Highly recommended.

We enjoyed the food, but surprisingly found that the Executive chef failed to introduce us or one of us to a number of dishes. Rare eye contact let alone words through the dinner. All we can feel is a 9-5 attitude. Overall, the lack of interaction with the executive chef was not like another omakase experience we had before. I appreciate the fact that Sous chef was interactive, humble, and respectful, otherwise I would rather order it as take out.
Went there a year ago the dishes are great and creative, nigiri is above average

Italian Kappo menu w/ sake pairing

Excellent the entire way through. Pairing was exceptional. No notes

What an Omakase Experience! We had an absolutely unforgettable time at this restaurant. Every dish felt like a work of art. The sake pairing and wine selection was spot-on. The ambiance was very inviting. A heartfelt thanks to the Chef and his Sous Chef for their incredible skill and dedication. Their passion for their craft truly shines through in every bite. I deeply appreciated how the Chef respected my dietary restriction of no meat. He thoughtfully crafted an exquisite alternative dish for me that was so flavorful and beautifully presented as the rest of the menu. This level of care and attention to detail truly elevated the dining experience and made it feel personal and unforgettable. If youâ€™re looking for an elevated dining experience with incredible food, great vibes, and excellent drink pairings, this is the place to be. Bravo!
Beautiful, Delicious, Fresh, Authentic, Great Experience!

Icca knocked it out of the park! We were running late, but the staff couldnâ€™t have been cooler. Super understanding and welcoming. The service? Absolute perfection. Chef Kazushige Suzuki and his fellow chef are on another level. Every bite was a flavor explosion! Fresh, delicious, and straight up unforgettable. The vibe is super chill and relaxed, making it the perfect spot to kick back and enjoy some incredible omakase.

Still my favorite sushiya. I've been here many times and it has been consistently great! Thank you, Kazu san.
=======
1st time at Icca and it was definitely worth it. Each dish and nigiri sushi were amazing! I have to say that Icca is top of the list in my book. Chef Suzuki was so friendly and made the entire experience phenomenal. The staff were all friendly and knowledgable of the food and sake. We had the standard sake pairing it was excellent. After dinner, we enjoyed more drinks (whiskeys and sake) at the lounge bar. We will definitely return and return.
Italian Kappo at Bar Counter. Ingredients paired really well with each other
Outstanding atmosphere and flawless service. I heartily recommend this to anyone looking for a great dining experience.

One of my favorite sushi restaurants in New York. Chef Suzuki is young but he is very professional and friendly. The staff was pleasant and welcoming. Come try it and you won't regret it. I can't wait to go back!!!
Very high quality fish. Chef is generous, please donâ€™t change.

Came here to celebrate my manâ€™s birthday as a treat. Staff was amazing, the food was so meticulously made, and the service was top-notched. Definitely worth the price tag since we had a 10 course meal and we were both stuffed at the end. Unfortunately Iâ€™m not a big seafood fan, so canâ€™t really speak for the taste, but food was really fresh and unique , and plating was excellent.
Authentic is Accurate.

Everything was perfect, service, foods,
ambience!
I love all the dishes especially sushi and appetizers, they were all beyond better!
I would definitely come back again!

So far my favorite omakase in the city. Love the ambience, the layout and decors. Absolutely amazing menu with many standout pieces and watching the chefs at work was magical. The unagi was my absolute favorite. Well worth the price. Will absolutely go back again soon!

I loveee this Omakase place
The food were good, delicious and fresh. This place is a must come back to me.
Excellent chef, food, hospitality & overall experience.  100% will come back & recommend to all my friends!

Siamo stati per provare lâ€™esperienza â€œItalian Kappoâ€ al banco. Atmosfera un poâ€™ fredda e triste, probabilmente dovuta al fatto che ci fossero pochissime persone. Personale cortese e gentile. Il menÃ¹ degustazione inizia benissimo, purtroppo non mantiene le aspettative fino alla fine. I piatti dallâ€™influ za giapponese sono molto buoni, lâ€™arrivo dellâ€™influenza italiana (sono italiano) non Ã¨ per nulla allâ€™altezza.
It's not bad, but feels like other omakase taste better at the similar price point, the crab doesn't taste like anything.
Great food and the sake pairing is designed perfectly with the food that day. Will come back for sure.
Icca kindly hosted a Japanese embassy collaboration dinner featuring Dashi. All dishes are like fine arts and taste is delicate. Nothing beats dashi ğŸ”¥

icca's Italian Japanese tasting course is not very Italian, but delicious nonetheless.

The restaurant itself is quiet and unassuming, but operates very smoothly. Unlike other tasting course menus, you will definitely leave full (and they will even ask you if you want a larger portion size towards the end), so come hungry! The dishes are generally fun, and the ingredients are definitely high quality.

I'd say the best courses were the cold pasta with tuna tartare and caviar (could eat a whole bowl of this!), apple compote and caramel mousse dessert, and the mackerel with truffle, while the tokachi herb beef fell short (a little bit too sweet and uncomfortably rich), as well as the red snapper fritto (the brussel sprout and sauce was great, but the fritto was just so average - could easily have been any fish). The fish-y pasta at the end was a lovely way to close off, and in particular, I really loved their use of vegetables throughout the courses. Also, the plum juice is absolutely divine.

I'm not sure if this would be a regular spot for me, but I'd say it's worth a visit, and it's lovely, peaceful, and quiet for a unassuming date night. Would recommend!
Icca is one of my favorite omakase spots in nyc now! Chef Kazu makes you feel like youâ€™ve been transported to Japan, such a memorable dining experience!
Excellent

I had a wonderful omakase experience at Icca. Great seasonal selections and preparations were done by Chef Kazu and the sous-chef. All staff members are friendly and approachable as well. Learned a lot about the food served from the chef and the staff.

Memorable items: smoked young tuna, abalone liver sauce nigiri, rock fish shabu shabu, sea urchin nigiri.

Visiting icca for their Italian Japanese tasting course was an experience I wonâ€™t forget. It was a perfect blend of pure enjoyment and focused culinary excellence, leaving me no time to take photo but only enjoy the food. Each dish broughtâ€¦

Celebrating my wife's birthday at Icca was an extraordinary experience that surpassed our expectations. From the moment we stepped in, the ambiance of the restaurant set the tone for a special evening. Seated in front of Chef Kazushige Suzuki, we were treated to an intimate culinary show, witnessing the artistry and precision that goes into every dish.The highlight of our meal was the omakase menu, a masterful display of traditional and unique flavors that left us in awe. Each dish, especially the sea urchin, was a revelation, showcasing the chef's skill in elevating simple ingredients to culinary heights.The sake pairing was a journey in itself. The house-made sake complemented each course beautifully, enhancing the flavors and adding an extra layer of enjoyment to our meal. The staff's knowledge and passion for sake were evident as they introduced each pairing, making the experience both educational and delightful.As we celebrated this special occasion, the attentive and considerate service made the evening even more memorable. The staff's dedication to ensuring every aspect of our meal was perfect contributed significantly to the joyous atmosphere of the night.In conclusion, our experience at Icca was nothing short of amazing. It was not just a meal, but a celebration of fine cuisine, exceptional service, and a birthday that will be remembered for years to come. A heartfelt thank you to the team at Icca for making this birthday celebration a truly magnificent one.
Wonderful atmosphere, excellent service, delicious omakase + sake pairing, and a wonderful experience altogether. A bit on the pricey side tho.

My friend an I went for the Italian Kappo. The staff was awesome. We chose to do the sale pairing and they introduced each and every one. (Iâ€™m not a huge fan of dry sake, I like more on the sweeter side. Hence they asked the chef for a replacement for one of the sakes. Very considerate). We had a very nice conversation with the staff and the food was amazing. None of the dishes were a disappointment. We are looking to come back to try their omakase.
Omakase war hervorragend, die Speisen von sehr guter QualitÃ¤t und der Service sehr freundlich.

If you are not familiar with the area, you may miss the small entrance and donâ€™t find a door, like me. You know Japanese things (people, food, road, etc.) are always small.
However, the food is amazing. Itâ€™s a combination of Italian and Japanese but also an art. I had three green source, and all of them are different.
Intimate, exquisite dining experience. Abalone, hairy crab with uni cold pasta and N34 Tokachi Herb Beef were fantastic. A must if you enjoy Japanese cuisine.

A great place to treat yourself or your significant other. Chef Suzuki is friendly to each customer and most importantly he makes great Japanese food. The materials are fresh, service is absolutely thoughtful. We even get our souvenirs when leaving.

Top notch omakase all around. Team is highly attentive. Chef was engaged and pulled together a fantastic meal. Great fish! Awesome uni! Loved the Italian influence in a couple of dishes.

Beautiful bar/dining area. Gorgeous sake glass selection.

Wow what an experience.. Excellent service, food and love the ambiance. Every dish that the chef prepared was amazing. The restaurant owner has a ranch northern part of Japan and they have their own cattle , which you can taste at Icca. The beef was really delicious. The abalone was really oishi The sake was just perfect. This is a must return for the spring.

Decent, but a bit overpriced. We tried their 13-course omakase at their  bar. They had some interesting courses like the abalone liver risotto. I didn't love some courses like their huge maki. The service was good and I did like the ambiance. But was it worth the $210pp price tag? No.

Absolutely amazing Japanese/Italian tasting course! Attentive and kind service, too. The ingredients are fresh and the chef made a great mix of meat and vegetables. Desert is also one of a kind. Beautiful combination of green tea and sweet potato brÃ»lÃ©e. Definitely will come back next time!

We came here for the omakase at the sushi counter. It was about 400/person prepaid in advanced. It seats about 8 people around the counter giving a private experience. Expect about 20 + dishes and spending 3 hours there.

The staff was attentive and ready to help. The chef was friendly and would occasionally engage in small talk.

I was initially worried about how much Italian influence there would be but it was unfounded. The hairy crab pasta was amazing!

Overall, the food was amazing. The fish was fresh. The abalone liver was bomb. The uni was very creamy. I really enjoyed my time there and would go back again next time Im here.

Reviewing restaurants at this price point is highly subjective, but thereâ€™s objective truth in Chef Kazuâ€™s ingenuity in seasoning. Icca is a must try for its crÃ¨me de la crÃ¨me appetizers and its fragrant authentic edomae sushi. Ingredient selection is luxurious but subtle, often boasting premium abalone, crab and sea urchin. Staffs are always attentive to needs and the dining environment is laidback.

A top 5 in NYC. Chef Kazu already has 2 michelin stars, and this menu is even better than his last at onodera. The interiors and service are 10/10, and the ingredient quality is really next level. Of course when you pay this kind of premium, the expectations are higher.. but theyâ€™ve exceeded that and more. Essentially the perfect sushi restaurant
Very good omakase experience. The food was amazing and service was top notch. However, at 500$ per person, I expected maybe 3-5 more courses, didn't feel super full at the end.
6/17 loved the Omakase experience tonight: from the appetizers to nigiri, from the ambience to the service, everything is just right.
Really nice place with innovative cuisine. The chef is lovely. Love their sake paring too. Definitely will recommend this place!

We were eager to check out this new spot in our neighborhood and we were not disappointed. We made a reservation for cocktails and had such a lovely time with Nathan, the bartender and creator of the cocktail program. The cocktails wereâ€¦

Iâ€™ve been to Icca a few times, and it is one of my two favorite sushi omakese experiences in NYC. Itâ€™s still very new and mainly known to hardcore sushi fans, but I expect that wonâ€™t last for long.

Any <5 star review seems to be for the tasting menu experience at the front of the restaurant, that I canâ€™t speak to.

What I can say is that the omakase experience at the back of the restaurant was one of the best, most memorable dining experiences Iâ€™ve had in a long time. Truly outstanding from beginning to end.

Def wort doing with the sake pairing as well!
